name: Night Owl
desc: Before you know it, it's way past bedtime. Lack of sleep may cause her to lose Energy.

name: Slacker
desc: "I don't really feel like practicing today..." May not show up to training.

name: Skin Outbreak
desc: Skin often doesn't cooperate at that age. May suffer from drops in Mood.

name: Slow Metabolism
desc: She's starting to put on some weight. Cannot gain Speed from training.

name: Migraine
desc: These migraines are getting her down. Cannot gain improvements in Mood.

name: Practice Poor
desc: Whoa! Be careful not to trip! Has an increased chance of failing training.

name: Fast Learner
desc: She picks things up so easily! Gains all kinds of tactical hints.

name: Charming ○
desc: "Training with you is fun!" Builds friendships with her training partners faster.

name: Hot Topic
desc: "Exemplary!", "She's the talk of the racing world!" Builds rapport with Etsuko Otonashi and Director Akikawa faster.

name: Practice Perfect ○
desc: She stays focused during practice. Has a decreased chance of failing training.

name: Practice Perfect ◎
desc: Practice makes perfect! Has a greatly decreased chance of failing training.

name: Under the Weather
desc: Some unknown issue is bringing her mind and body down. Has a greatly increased chance of failing training until fall.

name: Shining Brightly
desc: Both mind and body are in top condition! Has a decreased chance of failing training.

name: Fan Promise (Hokkaido)
desc: Win a race at Sapporo or Hakodate to fulfill her promise and get a boost from her fans.

name: Fan Promise (Hokuto)
desc: Win a race at Fukushima or Niigata to fulfill her promise and get a boost from her fans.

name: Fan Promise (Nakayama)
desc: Wins a race at Nakayama to fulfill her promise and get a boost from her fans.

name: Fan Promise (Kansai)
desc: Win a race at Kyoto or Hanshin to fulfill her promise and get a boost from her fans.

name: Fan Promise (Kokura)
desc: Win a race at Kokura to fulfill her promise and get a boost from her fans.

name: Not Ready
desc: She's just not quite race-ready... Competing in races may lead to fatigue.
